content.description:
Only 30 feet but action packed.  Named for the 2 small pockets at mid-height. Morning shade.

 First truly new route at OB for over 20 years.
content.location: Left-most route on NW face of Livin Large formation.

climbs.name: OB Juan
climbs.fa: Has not been led yet... need to get back there.

content.description:
A short arete with an unusual crux.  Hasn't been sent yet because I haven't been back since drilling it.

 Morning shade.

Based on the size of the crux holds, a better name might be "Livin Small".  If you are feeling the need for tiny crimping, this is your route.

 This was an old project of Joe's, drilled by either Joe or Tony.  It sat for 20+ years until we got back on it recently.

 The bottom 3 bolts are new stainless.  Bolt 2 is a half-incher SS.  Upper bolts and shuts are original but in good shape.  6 bolts in all I think.
content.location: Center of NW face of Livin Large Dome

content.description:
Three short but fairly interesting routes on NW face.  Shady until 1pm or so.

 The left route (Pocket Rocket) is new (2018) and not listed in EFR's 2015 guide.  Info for other routes was put together by Tony Lusk in mid-90s.  That's the source for EFR's info on page 302 of the 2015 guide.

 The middle route (Livin Large) is marked as route 31 and 5.12- in the 2015 guide.  It seems a bit stiffer than 12a. This route was never red-pointed back in the 90s.

 The right-hand route (OB Juan) is marked as route 32 (TR, 5.11) in the 2015 guide.  It had a rusty cold-shut anchor when we returned to it in 2018, but no bolts.  Not really sure what Tony (and Joe) had in mind for this route, so we just bolted it as we saw fit.
